intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Begnion is attacking Nevassa!

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: No! My parents live there! They're far too old and frail to defend themselves!

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: My wife and kids are there, too! It's that heartless murderer, Jarod... He just wants us to suffer to the bitter end.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Prince Pelleas! We have to do something. We must liberate Nevassa and save the people form this brutal attack!

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Is there no end to your lunacy?! The apostle's envoy is nearly here! Why be rash when victory is so close!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: People are dying, and Nevassa has already suffered more than enough. Do you really expect us not to lift a finger to help?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: If you will not help, we will go by ourselves. Again.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Wait! Where are you going?! You can't take the laguz and rush off on some harebrained mission again!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Can't I?

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Of course not, you idiot girl. You've already been far too impulsive, acting without the prince's consent. And do you think I do not see what has happened? Your name has been raised to lavish heights among the Daein people--your name, and yours alone! Why, even our own soldiers heap their praise on you like sugar on berries, sparing not a thought for their prince!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Oh...

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Hah! The prince! He's a sham, a travesty, a clod of mud no amount of polishing could shine. The real jewel--whose radiance attracts the people like moths to flame--is you, Priestess. And so I shall steal you and extinguish Daein's light of hope!!

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: And then, even once their rightful king is crowned, the people will still await the approval of their precious Priestess of Dawn. Why, if we are not careful, some calculating wretches might decide they would rather see a priestess on the throne instead of a king! And once again, this country will be torn apart, all because of your glory-hounding disregard for our prince's command!

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Please, Izuka...

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Come to think of it...perhaps our "Priestess" here has been planning this all along! Pretending to help the prince...when in truth she seeks to wear the crown herself!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Stop your tongue, worm, or my knife will stop it for you. The only one who seems too hungry for power here is you--
That's enough!!

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Izuka, Micaiah does not deserve any such attack on her character. She is pure and noble, and I... I am inadequate.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Have her actions poisoned your mind too, my prince?!

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Since we met, Micaiah has led every battle, even joining the soldiers on the battlefield. Not so with me. I...cannot defend my people. How could our people not rally around her? They see her fighting, throwing her lot in with their own. They respect her. That said, things cannot remain as they are. Izuka is right to worry about my standing. I need to earn my people's respect. Therefore... Therefore, I must take action.

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Um... Soldiers of the Liberation Army! Heed my-- No, no... Hear my words! I am Pelleas, true prince of Daein.

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Yes, we know who you are, milord! We ought to by now!

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: And so, uh... So... ...

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: ...Is he...all right?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Prince...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sir Knight?

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: ...And so... ...And so, beloved friends and comrades dear. With thanks to you, our capital lies close! And if we do not act, if we turn back, the war still ends with us the victors proud, and Daein's rule still falls back to our hands. And if we choose to fight and free this town, we may enrage the empire once again. Thus Daein's fortune turns to sorrow swift. But while I speak, Nevassa's hardship grows! Our brothers suffer, our sisters die, and... I shall not... I... I cannot ignore this tragedy. No man can, and certainly no prince... I cannot look away when my people suffer. And so I ask... I ask you all. Please, will you join me?!

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Long live the prince!

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Long live Prince Pelleas!

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Long live Daein! It's time to save our country!

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Ah...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Very well, my prince. We are at your service.

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: My army is arrayed and waiting. Be well. And...no overly heroic risks, please.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Company, at attention! Our objective is to save the town and take the keep! Now, move out!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: The rebels are on the move!

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Mm. And a good thing too. What is more honorable than a death fraught with purpose?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I wonder where Jarod is?

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Listen up, all of you. This is our last chance to die as we've lived. As proud soldiers of the empire. If we survive this fight, imprisonment and a hushed-up execution await us. If we run from this fight, dishonor and pursuit will dog our miserable days. So I say, let's give those Daein curs a fight to remember, and let the glory of our deaths light our way! We've lived as proud soldiers of the empire! Let us die as proud soldiers of the empire! Now GO!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: That shout...that's Jarod! For Daein's sake, this time I swear I will put an end to him.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: Maiden, take no risks upon yourself. You are the heart of this army, the soul that inspires us. We must not lose you. Leave this battle to me, and stay back.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Thank you for your concern, Sir Knight. But I am going to fight. You and everyone else are putting your lives on the line. I will not shirk my duty.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: You...are much...like her.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: What?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: ...Nothing.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Pardon, Sir Knight. I wanted to thank you. Thank you for fighting beside us.

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: No thanks are needed. I do nothing more than fulfill my duty.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: When our fighting is done...will you remain in Daein?

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Never mind. It's none of my business. It's only... If you were here with us, we could take heart in--

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: I may...take leave of Daein.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Oh! But why?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: More than this, I cannot say. Forgive me.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: ...What do you want?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Why are you trying to get close to Micaiah?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: So that I might protect her.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I protect her!

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: As things stand, I simply cannot entrust her safety to you.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: What is that supposed to mean?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: If you hope to protect her, become stronger. Strong enough to surpass me, and stronger still.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: What? What could he mean...

boss.speaker: Jarod
boss.line: Gh-ghuahh... I am...sorry for nothing. I regret...nothing. Because I did it my way... You win, Priestess. You must be delighted. Enjoy it while you can... Because...sooner or later...you...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: We won! We've taken back our country! Daein is under our control once again!

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Thank you, Micaiah... Thanks to you, the kingdom of Daein lives again.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I didn't do it alone. We did it--everyone fighting together.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Well, you didn't hurt the effort! I'd hazard a guess that Daein's reconstruction would have only been a dream without you. I regret I have no other way to show my gratitude, but... I want to officially name you Supreme Commander of the armies of Daein.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...I see. And I accept. It is with great honor that I assume this office. This battle may be over, but the fight to return Daein to its former glory will take time and effort. If my support can be of service, then I am honored to assist.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: I'm glad. Well then, I'll perform the simple ceremony... Will you kneel? In the name of the king of Daein, I dub thee, Micaiah, Supreme Commander of Daein and grant thee the authority and responsibility pertaining thereto.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...It feels...odd.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: You wear it well. Won't you join me, as I champion Daein to a great new era? I'm counting on you.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I will.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Are you really leaving already? Stay...at least for the feast tonight. You've done so much, you deserve some celebration! Nothing I can say will convince you to break bread with Lord Izuka?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Well, there is that. But honestly... If we stick around too long, the soldiers are gonna start giving us dirty looks. It's kind of awkward.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Most Daeins still loathe laguz. Getting rid of that hatred... Let's just say you have your work cut out for you. Look, we don't want to ruin everyone's party. It's been great, but we'll just quietly slip away.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: That's terrible! I can't believe I never noticed. Tormod, I'm so sorry.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Ah! Don't cry! I hate it when girls cry!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Um...take care of yourselves. It's, you know, good...that you came to help us. So...um... Thanks.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Whoa! You're thanking me? Better get ahold of yourself, Sothe. You're gonna make ME get all weepy.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You little...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Muarim, before you go... I just want to thank you. Thank you for not telling anyone about my brand.

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: No thanks are needed. It's rude of me to ask, but do you know anything about the circumstances of your birth?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: No. I know nothing of my parents. But just before she died, the old woman who raised me told me what the brand was and what it meant.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: This is proof that the blood of both beorc and laguz course through me. And so, I am anathema to both. She told me never to let anyone see it, and to be always on my guard.

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Wise advice...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I've avoided people most of my life to conceal my brand...and my powers. But there's no way to hide how very slowly I age. I just keep moving through Daein. The same holds true now... I won't be able to stay in this army long.

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Even so... As long as little Sothe is by your side, I think that you can overcome any difficulty.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yes... Just as you have Tormod.

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Vika
end.line: Muarim, Boss, I know you don't want to go, but at this rate, we'll be standing here all night.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Vika! My thanks go to you too. Sothe and I will visit you in the desert.

end.speaker: Vika
end.line: I'll be there...but I won't be waiting. Waiting for people who never come is...hard.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Vika, I said I'll come, and I will.

end.speaker: Vika
end.line: ...OK, then.

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: Micaiah, Sothe, we're going with them.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What? Aren't you going to Gallia?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Yeah. We're taking them. C'mon, neither of you can leave Daein for a little while, right? Don't worry, we can handle it.

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: Once the battle ended, it seemed time to move on. I'm sorry to change our plans, but this is better for all of us.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: That's awful... I can't believe you're all leaving us at once.

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: Micaiah... Fate brought us together, you and I, guided by the same voice. Our paths are fated to cross again someday... I am sure of it.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I'm embarrassed... I didn't mean...to cry... It's been so nice meeting you all...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: 'Til next time! 'Cause I know we'll meet again!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What was that sound?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Volug! Lady Nailah... Did she send you back to guard me, Volug?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Ridiculous... As if you didn't already have that annoying bird...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Ouch! Ow! Ow ow ow! I take it back!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, we freed our country from tyranny together. But it's not over yet. We'll have to work hard for a long time to return Daein to its former grandeur. I know it won't be easy, but if I have you two with me, I know we can do it.

conversation.speaker: Fiona
conversation.line: Lady Micaiah. I’m sorry to bother you while you prepare for battle. May I have a word with you?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Of course. What can I help you with?

conversation.speaker: Fiona
conversation.line: If my memory serves me correctly, you always use this type of tome, correct?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes, that’s right.

conversation.speaker: Fiona
conversation.line: Oh, I’m glad I remembered correctly. Then please, take this.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: For me? Are you sure?

conversation.speaker: Fiona
conversation.line: It’s a token of appreciation for letting me--and Marado--join your army.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: We’re lucky to have you. And thank you. I’ll use this tome well.

conversation.speaker: Fiona
conversation.line: Listening to Prince Pelleas’s speech earlier, I’m certain that Daein will exist anew. It will be a greater and more unified country than ever before!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I agree. So many things have happened along the way, but I am glad to be here now. I feel happy...and very proud.

conversation.speaker: Fiona
conversation.line: I feel the same way, and I’m sure all the soldiers of the Liberation Army do as well. Daein will soon be free... Lady Micaiah, please lead us to victory.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: ...Yes. Together, we shall see victory!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Volug, where-- How did you get this?

conversation.speaker: Volug
conversation.line: (I got it from the ruins in the desert.)

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: From the ruins of the desert? Oh, you got it when we were there before?

conversation.speaker: Volug
conversation.line: (No, not quite.)

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No? Then... how? When?

conversation.speaker: Volug
conversation.line: (You should keep it.)

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What? It’s for me?

conversation.speaker: Volug
conversation.line: (I will catch up to you later.)

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Wait! Volug? Did he go back to the desert just to get this...?
